Q2 ROUNDUP: MANCHIN RAISES $1.4m — Sen. Joe Manchin raised more than $1.4 million for his reelection in the second quarter of this year, Elana scoops this morning, leaving him with almost $3.5 million on hand as two of his GOP challengers face a brutal primary battle.

DEMS INTRO IDENTICAL SANCTIONS PACKAGE — House Democrats are trying to force the GOP’s hand in the Russia sanctions standoff, introducing a bill that’s the exact same as the Senate version, thereby fixing the “blue slip” issue that Republican leaders have said is delaying passage in the House.

CHC RAISES ALARMS ABOUT DACA FUTURE — DHS Secretary John Kelly wouldn’t commit to defending the DACA program in court – an Obama era order that grants work permits to undocumented immigrants brought here as children – during a meeting with the CHC Wednesday.

More: http://bit.ly/2uaz1sN

DEMS PUSH TRUMP IMPEACHMENT — Reps. Brad Sherman (D-Calif.) and Al Green (D-Texas) made good on their threats to introduce articles of impeachment against Trump, officially filing the paperwork Wednesday accusing the president of obstructing justice.

More: http://politi.co/2thMwT3

NO LOYALTY OATH HERE — Christopher Wray aced his five-hour confirmation hearing Wednesday, earning plaudits from both sides of the aisle for promising to be independent from the White House if confirmed as FBI director.

Wray said he hasn’t been asked for loyalty by anyone at the White House – as Trump reportedly did of former FBI director James Comey – and would “absolutely” fend off any attempts to interfere with special counsel Robert Mueller’s Russia probe.

WEDNESDAY’S TRIVIA WINNER — Logan Ferree was the first to correctly guess that Kansas Sen. Samuel Pomeroy was the first member of Congress to introduce a resolution for a women’s suffrage amendment to the Constitution, way back in 1868.

TODAY’S TRIVIA — Logan with today’s question: This governor, one of the first to be forcibly removed from office, faced backlash for declaring martial law in an effort to go after violent opposition by an organized group.

More: http://politi.co/2thBNYC

Hoosier State haul: Indiana Rep. Todd Rokita, who’s all but guaranteed to enter the race against Sen. Joe Donnelly next year, raised $1 million in Q2, giving him $2.3 million cash on hand.
